urls.description: Letters: Readers respond to a photo essay on bathers in the River Lea at Hackney Marshes in east London

tweets.text:
"We do know that local volunteers are pulling sanitary waste out of the river just upstream of 'Hackney Beach'." The reality of England's rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/rdKF8KpJFu
@StinkStopthe    M E Foley (Contractors) boss jailed for over two years https://t.co/4b7Kmjgxr4

@EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids Utter drivel , we have received little help against @RedIndustries2 who are polluting our community with their walleys quarry landfill pumping out Hydrogen sulfide at dangerous levels on at least 2 occassions and at least 3 breaches of their permit . @StinkStopthe

@StinkStopthe @LBCNews @guardian @DailyMirror @Telegraph @bbcmtd @ITVCentral @DailyMailUK @Daily_Express @theipaper This is a very regular occurence in our borough people are being poisoned by @RedIndustries2 and @EnvAgencyMids inaction https://t.co/JQvjgOriYn

tweets.text:
Anyone else find this shocking?

It's like the police asking the suspect to go to the scene of crime and report back if they find any evidence against themselves.

Nope? Oh well, that's case closed then, @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @AnglianWater @WaterUK. So cosy. 

Thread 1/2 https://t.co/yW86iuM1q8

‚ö†Ô∏è The Lea is among the most polluted rivers in London

Swimming there risks infection and diarrhoea, with BBQs and litter causing damage to wildlife, including kingfisher and owl nests

We recently wrote to @EnvAgency to request an update on work to tackle pollution in the river https://t.co/JMMo4ca5Cn

@RossCherrington @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance Field choice is the single most important factor. High risk crop on high risk field = huge soil loss.
